name: Safeguard Mutual Insurance Company, Appellant, v. Commonwealth

pin_cites.parenthetical: dissenting opinion by Nix, J., in which Roberts, J., joined
dissenting opinion by Nix, J., in which Roberts, J., joined

judges: Before Jones, C. J., Eagen, O’Brien, Roberts, Pomeroy, Nix and Manderino, JJ.

Mr. Justice Roberts, Mr. Justice Nix, and Mr. Justice Manderino dissent for the reasons expressed in Biello v. Liquor Control Board, 454 Pa. 179, 187, 301 A. 2d 849, 853 (1973) (dissenting opinion by Nix, J., in which Roberts, J., joined).
parties: Safeguard Mutual Insurance Company, Appellant, v. Commonwealth.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Per Curiam,
Order affirmed.
Mr. Justice Roberts, Mr. Justice Nix, and Mr. Justice Manderino dissent for the reasons expressed in Biello v. Liquor Control Board, 454 Pa. 179, 187, 301 A. 2d 849, 853 (1973) (dissenting opinion by Nix, J., in which Roberts, J., joined).
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Malcolm H. Waldron, Jr., for appellant.
Charles D. Cowley, Assistant Attorney General, with him Gerald Gornish, Deputy Attorney General, and J. Shane Creamer, Attorney General, for Commonwealth, appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Safeguard Mutual Insurance Company, Appellant, v. Commonwealth.
Argued May 25, 1972.
Before Jones, C. J., Eagen, O’Brien, Roberts, Pomeroy, Nix and Manderino, JJ.
Malcolm H. Waldron, Jr., for appellant.
Charles D. Cowley, Assistant Attorney General, with him Gerald Gornish, Deputy Attorney General, and J. Shane Creamer, Attorney General, for Commonwealth, appellee.
May 4, 1973:
